TopicTitle: Anyone else want unlimited feul in sandbox?

Articles.Content: Idk why but ever sence i swapped from playing on pc to console i cant get everywhere i once could on pc. In my opinion for people who just want to launch crazy things into space without the hassle of building them once you get up in the dark place is to give console players the option to use unlimited fuel in sandbox only, yano just for fun. Send your feedback in and let the awesome crew and creators see that we want some freedom in this next upcoming update... what do yall think?
Its already available in the Alt+F12 cheat menu, use at your own convenience.

Obviously it's not alt-f12 on console, but I'm sure you have the menu somewhere.

My condolences on your having to play on console.

Do you know when this update is suposed to be released? I liked playing on pc so much more then console, hope Squad sees this lol. That was the point of the post honestly.. to get everyone talking about it and pitch in to get them to see it lol

No one knows: Squad has the habit of never giving release dates for updates. They might have an internal deadline but all we can do is speculate.

Keep an eye on the KSP Weeklies as they give a little bit of information on the console builds each week, it's not much but that's your best chance for updates on the release.

The devs are probably debating on whether to just outright have it on the console menu, or require a code to open it.  Like maybe something emulating a certain Konami code.

Either case, @Bberg1970, you got your answer. As soon as what I more prefer to call the developer menu(as opposed to the icky sounding cheat menu) becomes available for the console version, you will have your unlimited fuel.

I wouldn't want to see unlimited fuel as the default option as it kind of defeats the whole object of KSP. One fuel tank and one engine can go anywhere in the system with unlimited fuel.  That would negate the need to build crazy huge rockets that may or may may not explode and may or may not get you to where you want to go.
